alfredsnippet.snippet:
"If you took away convection, the sun and other stars would be boring. They would just sit there. Prominences, sunspots, the solar wind, the sun's magnetic field, all this complex behaviour simply would not be there if the sun were just radiating into space. Most of the exciting behaviour of the sun occurs because it is boiling."

- Fausto Catteneo, astrophysicist at the University of Chicago.
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Solar Convection
